title: Guidelines for Cryptographic Algorithm Agility and Selecting Mandatory-to-Implement Algorithms
abstract:
Many IETF protocols use cryptographic algorithms to provide confidentiality,
integrity, authentication, or digital signature.  Communicating peers must
support a common set of cryptographic algorithms for these mechanisms to work
properly.  This memo provides guidelines to ensure that protocols have the
ability to migrate from one mandatory-to-implement algorithm suite to another
over time.
